greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Li_{-n}(phi) + Li_{-n}(1-phi), where Li_n(x) is the polylogarithm, phi=(1+sqrt(5))/2 is the golden ratio.
comment: 2*Li_{-n}(phi) = a(n) - (-1)^n*A000557(n)*sqrt(5), so a(n) represents integer terms in 2*Li_{-n}(phi), and A000557(n) (with alternating signs) represents terms proportional to sqrt(5).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..97
mathematica: Table[(-1)^(n+1) Sum[k! LucasL[k+2] StirlingS2[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 20}]
program: (PARI) vector(100, n, n--; (-1)^(n+1)*sum(k=0, n, k!*stirling(n, k, 2)*(2*fibonacci(k+1) + fibonacci(k+2)))) \\ _Altug Alkan_, Oct 31 2015
results.author: _Vladimir Reshetnikov_, Oct 30 2015
